intro: Clidemia cyanocarpa, commonly known as blue-fruited false coffee, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its small, white to pale blue flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences, and the fruit is a small, blue-black drupe. Clidemia cyanocarpa is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and rocky slopes.
